greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of permutations of [n] with k ordered cycles such that equal-sized cycles are ordered with increasing least elements; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: Each cycle is written with the smallest element first and equal-sized cycles are arranged in increasing order of their first elements.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, p) option remember; expand(`if`(n=0 or i=1,
mathematica: b[n_, i_, p_] := b[n, i, p] = Expand[If[n == 0 || i == 1, (p + n)!/n!*x^n, Sum[b[n - i*j, i - 1, p + j]*(i - 1)!^j*multinomial[n, Join[{n - i*j}, Table[i, j]]]/j!^2*x^j, {j, 0, n/i}]]];
T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, n}]][b[n, n, 0]];
Table[T[n], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 28 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Main diagonal and first lower diagonal give: A000012, A002411.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 27 2017
